title: NOAA report highlights 2021 climate, weather, ocean research
content:
A whale swims as a NOAA research vessel sails in the Gulf of Mexico. Credit: NOAA

A whale swims as a NOAA research vessel sails in the Gulf of Mexico. Credit: NOAA Launching the first ever national rip current forecast model, creating high-resolution sea ice information to improve navigation, and using artificial intelligence to process marine mammal calls: These are just a few of NOAA’s many notable scientific accomplishments from the past year. The newly released 2021 NOAA Science Report includes more than 60 stories that represent a selection of NOAA’s 2021 research and development accomplishments across the range of NOAA’s mission. Read more at the link below. Click to read the full article
